We've stayed at a lot of Air bnb's over the years and not every one provides those extras in case you forget something, but Laura did! The bed was VERY comfortable and she even provides fans in every bedroom for those who like to sleep with some white noise. The property is very walkable to restaurants and the downtown square. It was a great weekend! Thanks Laura!

This home was in THE PERFECT location to the city square. We could walk to the fall festival, buy tons of items, take them home and then walk back up to the square, lol. We could walk to several coffee shops and restaurants. You can not find a more convenient home.
Check in was super easy, off street parking was great and coffee and snacks were made available in the home.
I stay in Airbnbs all the time. I have NEVER been in one this clean. It was spotless. The blinds, baseboards, floors and light fixtures were all spotless. There is a crystal light fixture above the dining table that had tons of dangling crystals and they were spotless. Iâ€™m a clean freak and I notice these things. Trust me, the place was CLEAN!
The bedding is all crisp and white. The bath towels were white and so so thick. Think 4 Seasons quality. They were THICK.
This place was perfect. Absolutely perfect.

Only 15 minutes to Devilâ€™s Lake and 20 minutes to the International Crane Foundation (highly recommend to view 15 species of crane from around the world and support conservation efforts!). Thereâ€™s an amazing amount of outdoor fun to be experienced in the Baraboo area, and Kristenâ€™s Cabin is the perfect home base for it all! review_text:
We spent a weekend at the cabin and it was simply lovely. The property is gorgeous, and the birds are an added treat. There are several paths to hike right off the cabin, we tackled two and both were fairly easy treks. The peacocks do come up on the deck, and will look in the windows, occasionally one would walk up when we were outside and put on a show for us! I guess you have to be an animal lover to appreciate it, but it is something to see! The roosters are loud, like roosters are, but we got used to them pretty quick. The cabin was very clean, and very easy, specific instructions were left out with some helpful hints on the surrounding area and trails. The owners were not intrusive whatsoever but checked in here and there to make sure we were doing alright which was appreciated. There were even deer standing along the drive to see us off when we left!
Our trip was cut short due to a family emergency, but I would and have recommended this cabin for anyone we know who loves the outdoors and is looking for a nice, relaxing weekend away.

Fun backyard with fire pit and garage had a retro pool table, darts and badminton!
Cool Airbnb experience with lots of extra treats upon entry made us feel right at home! Baraboo is a really fun town! We enjoyed Little Village Cafe, Devilâ€™s Lake, Spin Shack, and Tumble Rocks indoor chill fireplace area!

name: Jackie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This little renovated cottage surprised us, in a good way! Almost everything has been redone or at least refreshed with a definite eye to style and is clean, clean, clean. The kitchen is roomy and well supplied with many small appliances, sufficient dishware, table service, cook pots, etc. There is a lovely new bathroom, the beds are comfortable, and the large-screen television works well without your having to be an electrical engineer. Andrey was prompt and courteous with his replies to our texts. We encountered only two little hiccups during our stay. The first involved a rain-swollen door and keypad when we arrived. We had the correct code but a stubborn deadbolt refused to budge. It finally opened for us but we were leery of it during the remainder of our stay. And then there is the matter of the washer/dryer. Please be aware that they are located in the unfinished basement, at the bottom of steep old wooden stairs that are concealed by a hinged floor panel under the kitchen table. Yes. But both machines work well and there is sufficient lighting to mitigate the spooky factor. This house is in a quiet neighborhood, a short drive to the Log Cabin Family Restaurant (recommended!), and offers off-street parking. Rain kept us from taking advantage of the grill, seating, fire-pit in the backyard, but we thoroughly enjoyed the inside of the house. Thank you, Andrey.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: At our initial arrival we were somewhat disappointed as the home from the outside does leave a lot to be desired. However after opening the door we were pleasantly surprised at the decor. I am a hotelier spending more than 20 years in the hospitality industry and immediately I could tell that Andrey had some hotel background. I love the soft touches of in shower shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. With further exploration I discovered that there was the addition of toothbrush just in case you needed on as I did. Additionally the kitchen was outfitted with necessary spices, cookware and dishwasher. We also found it very helpful to have streaming services setup for guest as this location is about 15mon drive from entertainment. However we found it a little eerie having the unlocked basement door thatâ€™s located within the kitchen floor, with the back door which allows someone to look directly into the home as it doesnâ€™t have a covering over the window. This element made it feel a bit uncomfortable for our liking and also strange as the rest of the house has great window coverings which also limited the amount of light allowed in the house when sleeping for those who have light sensitivity and can be easily awakened. We also had challenges with the door lock which, we found it hard to lock and unlock the door I eventually had to ask my husband to turn the lock with his man strength. Last because the home is older we often found ourselves killing bugs during the day and night and I donâ€™t like bugs of any kind, well except the lady bug that greeted us on our first night. Also my husband who is barely 5â€™6 was standing up in the main bedroom and his hand hit the fan while it was running and the blade cam crashing down. The fan was very nice in the evenings while sleeping as I tend to get very warm at night but the low ceilings cause the ceiling fan to be a nuisance we had to end up paying to replace the fan rightfully so as it was broken during our stay, but for future guest be careful. We did however appreciate the guest book that detailed stay rules and accommodations such as wifi passcode, what to do in the local area and what to do before we leave and how to prepare for check out. I could tell that all these details were thoughtfully planned and that was appreciated. Overall we enjoyed our stay but we have it a four because of the uncovered window off of the kitchen and the bug issue. Thanks for everything Andrey!

We loved the location, the yard was awesome (we made a fire one night), and we slept so well with super comfortable beds and very nice bedding. Its not a hugely kid-friendly home in that there are a number of decorative items that we had to put up to make sure they weren't played with and not a lot of cleaning supplies for messes, but we loved the house. For the price point I think it would be nice to have some extras (coffee, shampoo and conditioner, lawn chairs for around the fire pit) and the checkout instructions were pretty extensive compared to most Airbnb's I've stayed at over the years (pull all the bedding and towels and put in a hamper, bring garbage and recycling out to alley and wash dishes) considering the fees. I still recommend the home for larger groups and older guests. We had a wonderful time!

review_text:
My wife and I were looking for a place on the water with proximity to both the Dells and Madison, and this place delivered on what we wanted. It's very small and only recommended for one or two people. The setting is beautiful with views of the hills on the other side of the lake. It's set back in an area of backwater channels so you don't really have an open water view from the house, but walk across the street to the park there you can see more of the breadth of the lake.
We didn't realize that canoes or kayaks were available, and we ended up using them one day and it turned out to be a fantasic beach day. There are numerous sandbar areas within a very short paddle from the house.
Our only issues were a musty smell in the bathroom, and the lack of a broom and dustpan, but I'm sure if we asked we could have gotten that. The hosts were very responsive and accommodating and the house was very well appointed.

Brian was very welcoming and friendly. We will definitely be back again!

review_text:
We are a young couple with a 2 year old that enjoys spending time outside. We found this listing pretty last minute as we didnâ€™t know where to stay for our planned days off. When I found this listing I was pleasantly surprised by the affordable price and proximity to several state parks and nature centers.
The pictures of the inside of the cabin are very accurate. It is quite small but has everything you need, and we had a great time staying here with our toddler for 3 nights. The shower has lovely hot water and great water pressure ðŸ˜Š and whole place was very clean and had no weird or musty smells. There is no stove so we brought our hot plate to make breakfast but we were pleasantly surprised the owners provide an electric skillet to cook in.
We did outings to the Devilâ€™s lake state park, Parfreyâ€™s Glen Creek and the Mackenzie Center. While we can Google what to do in the area, I loved the binder of info Brian provides. It gives you a list of attractions and places to eat and helps to keep you off the phone ðŸ˜Š. We loved the playground across the street and the view of the water.
My only minus is I didnâ€™t realize this was a normal residential street because the pictures show only the inside of the house and the nature, but thereâ€™s houses on both sides and a street right in front of the house. Check in and check out was super easy and Brian was flexible with our checkout which we really appreciated.
Iâ€™d recommend staying here for a very affordable way to see the area, hike and relax.

name: Kelly
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is exactly as described. It is a rustic cabin. It is tiny so the only way you'll have space is by getting outdoors. Not having a full kitchen became a little difficult for us since we brought our dog with and don't leave her in strangers houses alone. The closest food was 15 to 20 minutes away. It is a good spot though 15 to an hour away from good hiking and towns you want to visit. Hiking on the ice age trails was beautiful and those didn't cost anything. Waking up to the river seeing deer and other wildlife in it was amazing. Watching the sunsets was just beautiful and relaxing. If you stay here I recommend bringing a swimsuit since you can wade out into the water. Now Brian said the bathrooms being redone but I can tell you if your big and tall you will not fit in the shower. We thoroughly enjoyed our time... We wished food was a little closer especially our last day staying there since we got stuck on the side of the road and had to put our spare tire on... So going 20 minutes to get food was out of the question. Also if you're in the area and need tire service I recommend Pomps tire... They're also the only ones open on a Saturday. Yes I would recommend this rustic cabin to any small family or for individuals looking for great fishing, hiking and exploring.

Brian was a great host. The cabin was great and the prefect location for our vacation. We stayed 5 nights at the cabin. The weather was perfect all week. The park across the street is great for fishing, swimming, and wading the waters of the Wisconsin River. Brian even offered to let us use his canoes if we wanted.
He was very responsive to any questions we had. The book Brian provided he recommended several great restaurants and none of them disappointed. Susie's Supreme from Log Cabin Pizza in Lodi was delicious.
We visited Wisconsin Dells, Devil's Lake, Castle Rock Lake, all within an hours drive from the cabin. The perfect getaway from Missouri's recording break heat. I highly recommend the Little Cabin.

My partner and I had no trouble preparing all of our meals there, which we appreciated being able to do during COVID times. Even more importantly, the location is fantastic. We spent the weekend hiking in Devils Lake, biking on nearby trails, and enjoying the views of Lake Wisconsin from the park across the street. This cabin is an incredible value, and was a perfect location for a long weekend getaway from Chicago. I hope to be back soon!

Most important, Brian and his family were extremely hospitable, lending us a canoe (they also had kayaks) one day and setting up a fire pit for us another night. Convenient launching point for Devil's Lake (about 35 min away) and other state parks. Also, I was a bit wary of noise seeing the pics of the playground across the street, but it was extremely quiet, with lovely picnic tables for enjoying coffee or meals while admiring the river - and the only public park we found anywhere nearby, so the location is actually ideal.

During Covid-19, my boyfriend and I were looking for a weekend getaway from the city. The Simple Cabin was a great spot to lay our heads after a day of hiking. Brian was very responsive and had a no-contact key transfer, which we appreciated. The cabin was very clean and made us feel comfortable in the space - it is also nicely nestled along the Wisconsin River with views from the front door. We were a bit unlucky with rainy weather but we still snuck in some hikes at Devils Lake State Park and Natural Bridge (each about a 40 min drive from the cabin).
It should be noted that there is no stove, which under normal circumstances would be fine, but was a little harder during Covid and not wanting to eat out at restaurants that much (this is clearly listed in the amenities section of the listing). There is a microwave, toaster oven, and hot plate and we made do! This is a terrifc option for those looking for a quieter getaway and to explore some of the best state parks Wisconsin has to offer.

The neighborhood is a perfect place to go for a morning or evening stroll to take in views of the lake, the homes, and the fantastic sunrises and sunsets. HIGHLY recommend staying at Brian's place!

Weâ€™ve been living in Chicago for a few years and really wanted to get away for a few days.
Nellieâ€™s chalet was just what we needed. Itâ€™s a beautiful A-frame on a hillside, and while itâ€™s tucked into the woods â€” very cozy and private â€” you can see the rolling hills and fields (and cows!) beyond the trees from the huge windows and VAST deck.
The space is very clean and open, with a modern feeling. The kitchen has everything you could ever need to entertain (even a wine fridge!). The main room is filled with natural light from the floor-to-ceiling windows, and so comfortable: huge sectional couch, vintage chairs, ambient lighting. Thereâ€™s a very sleek entertainment system â€“ with a TV and surround-sound music (!). This was a mid-April weekend in Wisconsin, but we tried the hot tub anyway. Fabulous!.
I came to Baraboo to get away and do some writing; my husband wanted to hike and enjoy the (charming!) town. It was perfect for both of us.
Already planning our return trip!!

review_text:
What a fabulous 3 level house! Plenty of room for the 7 of us.
Top floor has a primary bedroom with en suite bathroom, another bedroom with bathroom across the hall.
Main floor has spacious kitchen/living room combo with two sliding glass doors that led to the wraparound porch. Also had two bedrooms and a bathroom.
Lower level has a beautiful bar and access to the lower spacious patio that has beautiful furniture and an umbrella. Also has another bedroom and bathroom (no shower in lower bathroom).
Just beyond the lower patio was a fire pit with plenty of seating. We enjoy an evening fire while we listened to music playing at the local bar/restaurant tumbled rock brewery.
Our host, Gregg, was very responsive to any questions we had. Also gave us recommendations on things to do locally. I highly recommend this home.

We used the grill (nice) and brought a griddle; he had plenty of visible propane. We cooked in the kitchen; there were many supplies and plenty of the necessities (bowls, pans, cookie sheets, tin foil, etc).
The location is awesome; it was a short drive to anything we wanted.
The price seemed a little high at first, but i haven't gotten used to the new normal...and after staying there, I think it was well worth the cost!

review_text:
We booked our stay after recommendation from our daughter and we are so happy we did!
We drove the last part of our travels avoiding high ways and toll roads and really started enjoying the area, that we would be in for 3 days, and which let us into Babaroo via the back road.
The house is down town and although baraboo has big stores, you have the feeling being in a small town.
On the side of the house is a big enough parking place where you can park your car. The house is in a quiet area and still in the centre. The house is beautifull maintained. You can sit on the beautifull porch and the living room. We felt pampered with the abiltiy to make warm drinks and some sweet snacks.
When you want to visit the area in and around baraboo and visit Devil's State Park, than this is the place to be.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We felt pampered from the start!

review_text:
Great experience at this charming, very clean, and comfortable home.
Pam was extremely available to respond to us; gave great recommendations for restaurants and DL Park hiking. She provided many thoughtful amenities, and gave us historical information about the house and the town.
The room has an electric fireplace, comfy bed , mini fridge, 2 nice size chairs and adjoining bathroom. The well stocked snack/breakfast station is right outside the room in a common space. The 1st floor parlor is bright, spacious, comfortable and available to all guests.
We easily found the house. There was a little road work in the area, but it wasnâ€™t a big deal to navigate.
The town is quaint and restaurants and bars are walkable.
Since we were there on a Sunday afternoon and Monday, in March, many stores were closed.
We parked in a lot across the street and felt the car was safe.
Devils Lake is a short drive away.
Itâ€™s a beautiful park!
We really liked hiking there.
Excited to come back!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Ash Street Retreat is a restored, older home in downtown Baraboo which is itself full of history. The room (and private bathroom) was clean, and there was a small snack/amenities area right off the bedroom area in the hallway. Other guests were staying at the same time. Besides occasionally hearing them come and go (steps on the stairway, door closing), it was very quiet and we barely saw the other guests other than seeing some of them sitting on the large wrap around porch. The porch is large enough and has enough seating that 2 or 3 groups of guests can easily be out there at the same time without having the feeling of â€œsharingâ€ the area. Downtown Baraboo is just a treasure trove of shops, eateries, spas, bars, etc...and all within walking distance. In fact, we didnâ€™t get to do all that we wanted to as we just ran out of time. Steph and Ike provided a binder with much information on local places to eat and other attractions as well as information about the room. It was a fantastic stay, especially for the price. Highly recommend!

review_text: Amazing place to stay! Very nice hosts and for a very good price. 15 minutes from the Kalahari waterpark and not much farther from downtown Dells. There are two other guest rooms and between them all is a little breakfast station which has fruit, a Keurig coffee machine, water, a large mini fridge, microwave, toaster oven, plates, silverware, and cups/mugs. There is also a small mini fridge in the room as well as an electric fireplace. Floor and bed is very creaky but you get used to it. Big street view window. Wifi is good but the signal has a hard time reaching into this room, and the door is a bit difficult to lock. Just pull it toward you and lock it when you leave. They key is left in the keyhole when you arrive. All in all, its was an amazing stay for us and we definitely recommend it :)

review_text:
We greatly enjoyed our stay at this lovely spot! We found the bed, pillow, and linens to be exceptionally comfortable, and the room and home to be spotlessly clean and welcoming. The big bay windows, rugs, and fireplace made the room atmospheric, and it was so nice to have treats, fruit, Keurig coffee, and tea right outside our door. The morning pastries were very tasty!
We also enjoyed the proximity to Baraboo's sweet downtown and the delicious coffee shop right down the road.
The check-in process was incredibly easy. Steph and Ike were available if we needed anything and they were very prompt in their responses to messages!
Thanks again!
Kerry and Mart

review_text: Steph and Ike have a charming home and are lovely hosts. Great communication throughout the whole booking process and during our stay. I'm sorry that we didn't get to actually meet in person, but we did enjoy breakfast at a local diner they'd recommended. Our room was comfortable and full of many thoughtful details- like colored pencils and paper for journaling! It was so nice to have hot coffee waiting for me in the morning. Plenty of healthy snacks available, too. They even had a smart selection of books. And the location was perfect- very walkable! Just blocks from downtown. We also enjoyed exploring the residential neighborhood during our walks to Driftless Glen Distillery and Circus World. Plus, only a 10 minute drive to Devil's Lake. We'd love to return... Honestly, wish I'd had more time to just sit on the porch.

name: Lawton
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2018
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I can't imagine a better place to stay in the Baraboo/Wisconsin Dells area. Steph and Ike's home is a beautifully updated turn of the century building within easy walking distance of all the charming shops, cafes, and in-town activities Baraboo, Wisconsin has to offer. I mean it is directly adjacent to the main town square in an upscale, very safe neighborhood. In addition to the wonderful building and location, Steph and Ike were exceptionally accommodating and their communication was lightning fast. They provided a notebook filled with information about the house and town as well as recommendations for places to eat, get coffee, ect. It was a fantastic experience from start to finish. Before ending this review, I want to make special note of the bed and pillow quality. The bed was so comfortable and the pillows so soft yet substantial, it was difficult to get up and about in the morning. The bed was a very nice touch on top of an all around beautifully furnished and decorated room.
